reviews.review_msg: She honestly deserves a 5/5- I've never met a prof like her. She actually cares about her students and their success. She makes a science course easy to understand- especially for non-science related majors. Her lectures are simple and she ensures that every complicated aspect to it is understandable. Climate change memo was lowkey fun.
The professor is awesome. Course didn't require much time and was fairly easy. The only hard part was the climate change solutions memo, which caused a lot of people's grades to drop.

I took GEOG 104 as a breadth science course. Every week Professor Holland would assign us a list of things we needed to do; discussion post, short assignment, and every other week a 15 question openbook quiz. I recommend this to everyone as a doable and easy class. I took it during the Summer intersession and spent only 6-7 hours a week.
Very difficult marker and is extremely particular on what she is looking for. Lowest grade I have received in my 3 years of university.
Dr. Holland was an amazing professor, and her class was set up really nice I actually feel like I walked away learning something. Definitely take a class with her.

This was an easy and interesting class MOSTLY because of the professor. She genuinely cares about her students and wants to teach in a way that keeps students engaged- even as an online course. She is an absolute angel. 10/10 prof.
easiest class you'll ever take

Tara is an amazing professor. The content she taught was genuinely interesting and her lectures were extremely easy to follow! The assignments were easy to do. However, I just wish the TA's would provide a bit more feedback for assignments. Please take a course with Tara she is so passionate about what she teaches, it really rubs off on you!
Material is super easy. Lots of assignments, but it's an online course, so it's fair.  Grading is sometimes unclear, as people mentioned before

I thought I was the only one with a bad experience with the memo. I worked so hard for an A+ just for the memo to drop me to an A. Prof made it clear there were no regrades for that too... I wonder if it was because grades were too high and they had to find some way to drop everyone's mark down. Not fair imo for those who worked hard

Weekly mundane busy work to get through, though not very difficult at all. TAs are terrible at marking and will ruin your grade with the memo if it isn't anything less than perfect. Lectures are insightful for the most part and course resources are well organized.

Class is meh, lots of reflections and personal connections have to be made. TA's absolutely ruin your grade at the end and show no mercy marking the final synthesis memo. Be ready to drop a letter grade if you didn't put in like 10 hours completing the assignment. Tara is respectful, but TA's ruined it for me...
TAs are horrible markers. Do well on everything during the semester so when they mark your memo you don't drop a whole letter grade. Tough markers.

Very engaging prof, even asks at the end of semester how she can teach better. Took 2  of her classes (GEOG111+EVSC100), learned a lot in both and got good grades too while not being super stressed about studying and workload.

Took this class as part of my degree, it was great! The main project is a research paper of your own topic which you work on throughout the term. Prof is super nice and very willing to explain where you went wrong in your writing. They gave deadlines for drafts and had plenty of helpful workshops

The class is great if you want a real introduction to physical geography. I thought I was prepared for the lab exam, but it was harder than it seemed, dont skip studying for it. The prof is really passionate about the topics in the course so the lectures aren't too bad to sit through. Grading was fair and evenly weighted

Her course Canvas page is very organized making it easy to stay on top of things. The class is very straight forward and some of/a lot of it is common sense. There is an optional textbook, but I didn't even bother buying it and there were no questions on tests or quizzes on it. Overall, a good class.

Tara is amazing! One of the best lecturers I've had yet. Course work was fair given that it was intersession, but TAs weren't the best at giving feedback that reflected your grade. Tests were very straightforward too.

Tara is a great professor and GEOG 111 is a smart choice for non-science students looking for a relatively easy B-SCI course. As long as you review lecture slides before tests and complete all the labs you will do well! Tara makes boring geography stuff as interesting as possible and is very reasonable in terms of quizzes/scheduling.

Tara's class organization was seamless, making the course navigation easy, especially during the strike this semester. Her lectures were information-heavy, but her slides were great. Sometimes quizzes focused only on 1 out of the many learning objectives. However, an amazing prof, definitely take class with her again! She's super cool and caring.

I found this class to be so so difficult. The TA I had did a very bad job at running my lab and explaining lab concepts. The labs and lectures are quite unrelated. The case study quizzes are so difficult and not entirely based on the learning objectives we are told to use as a study guide. Lab exam was so hard, I believe I failed. Not very happy.

Highly recommend this prof!!! Makes 2 hour lectures feel shorter because they are engaging and interesting, very clear syllabus and slides, labs relate to course content, and bonus no midterm or final for lecture content. Chiefs kiss

This is by far the best online class! So well organized you cannot help but succeed if you follow along in a timely manner. The text book is nice to have but not necessary. Tara really cares about the environment and her students. Marking is fair and quick. Highly recommend this class.

Tara is one of the best professors I've had so far. She is very caring and tries her best to help everyone succeed. Lectures aren't recorded so attendance is suggested. Graded on lab worksheets, weekly activities, midterm, final, and portfolio. Super engaging and expectations are very clear. Would definitely take her class again!

Tara is a good prof. The course itself was interesting but content was dry at times - that's no fault of her own, sometimes things are just not as interesting. She was fair when it came to criteria for exams and the engaging part of lectures help you study. The labs are quite tedious, but doable. However, the lab exam is difficult so study hard

Tara is AWESOME! She introduced us to some great tools for writing papers and I feel so confident reading academic literature and writing literature reviews after taking EVSC 201W (not GEOG266W) with her. She gives great feedback on assignments as well. Super approachable, well spoken and knowledgable.

I love the lectures, both structure and content. I really appreciated how interactive the lectures were as well as the opportunity to have a break in the middle. The difficulty was moderate, challenging but not impossible.


Professor was very approachable and encouraged questions.
I plan to purposefully look for courses by this proffesor.

took as a gpa booster. lectures were fully online, tutorials were in-person. dr. holland supplies lots of helpful resources and materials to foster your learning. lectures are also clear and easy to follow! everything was clearly explained and organized. TA did the grading and gave good feedback. recommend it for sure! [intersession, summer 2022]

For the online version of this course, instead of relying on one lecture or textbook she had an array of different sources you could click through. Everything in the course was explained clearly and connected, tutorials were relevant, and the the midterm and final was clearly explained. YMMV in-person, but the online modules were well planned.
Tara is a great prof who cares about her students. She provides great resources to help improve your understanding.

This is a fairly new offering course by GEOG, department is stupid enough to put this course on the graduation requirement for students when they don't have this course ready yet. So well done SFU I have to take an introductory level of writing course while I have already written tons of papers for a bunch of 300 level courses for a whole year.
Quizzes are easy, and quiet many assignments to do. Tara is also nice and friendly! The worst about GEOG104 - TA are tough marker...
really enjoyed this class and would def recommend it as a GPA booster!

Great prof, can tell she really cares and wants students to understand the content. Lots of participation assignments but were mostly just for completion. I'm not great at science but found the prof made the content easy to understand. Very understanding considering quarantine as well!
Great prof. Enjoyed the course and was taught well. Would highly recommend to another student.

Not really a GPA booster as the TA's are picky with the assignments. Tests and quizzes are easy as long as u go over the material. Anywho why does it matter global warming is not real anyways. Tara was a solid prof tho but since global warming is fake the class is fake.
Loved her classes. She goes out of her way to make sure the classes are engaging.

Dr. Holland is seriously my favourite prof of all time! I took this course as an elective and loved it so much that I'm switching my major, she's so inspiring! Her lectures are easy to follow and the weekly material only takes an hour or two. Her midterm and final are SUPER fair and it's easy to do well if you follow along :) 10/10 would recommend!

Super organized and responds to emails really fast which made online learning so nice. Her quizzes and exam were exactly what you would expect given the material. If taken online, I highly recommend going to the optional Zoom Q&As to really solidify your learning. Overall, she's a great teacher who is very caring and easy to talk to.

Tara is really understanding, compassionate, and inspiring. She delivers a good overview on EVSC issues, while also addressing how to remain optimistic. Labs are a breeze if you have taken any other STEM class. Tests only have content from learning goals on them, so easy to study for. Not a difficult course, but really engaging content.

I loved learning about environmental science because Tara made it super easy to understand the material. There are assignments and tutorials every week. Tests were fair and all you need to do is write notes every week and you'll be good for midterms and finals.

Dr. Holland is an amazing professor! You can tell she's passionate about what she's teaching. The course itself is also very interesting and quite easy if you go through all the materials provided (which is not an overwhelming amount like some online classes). She is very understanding and makes adjustments if you need. 10/10

One of the best, if not the best, professors adapting to online learning. Everything was clearly outlined e.g. the learning goals which made the midterm/final relatively easy as there were no surprises. Courseload wasn't hard whatsoever and content was made interesting as she managed to incorporate current events to the curriculum.

Tara's a good choice for science electives. Took her in Summer 2020 and the midterm and final were very confusing. I felt like I did alright, but turns out I barely passed and half of the class did poorly too. Tutorial assignments are a grade booster along with discussion posts.

Her course is well thought out, structured, organized, she's even very nice. She'd just not fit to be a professor due to her grading. I am a 4th year taking a 100 level course with her and she's the toughest grader I have this semester. Clear grading criteria, but she doesn't follow it herself. Most unfair marker I've had

For a 100 level course there were a lot of things she did that didnt make sense. Midterm was 70 short answer questions/mc she gave us only an hour to struggle through them. Way more concerned with making sure we couldnt cheat than if we learned. Resulted in low avg and she didnt take feedback aside from a delayed canvas survey 2 weeks later

Tara is super organized. No issues there. But I took this course online and she is delusioned about how online courses work. Midterm was super straight forward, yet over 50% of the class failed it because she insisted it be CLOSED BOOK. When I emailed her my concerns she basically said suck it up. She might be ok in person but avoid online

Tara is by far the best prof I've had at SFU. I was anxious about having to do a term of group work, but she made it so easy. She was always accessible if you needed help, and gave very thorough feedback. She is an amazing prof who genuinely wants to see her students do well. Put in the effort necessary, and the class is a breeze!

She cares about her students and tries extremely creative ways to improve your learning as a student. Attending lectures and tutorials will get you free marks, and studying her midterm/exam guideline will give you an easy A. Great prof!

Tara's a pretty damn good professor. Her class was super easy and she really tries to get her students engaged and make the material interesting. Exams are pretty easy, and the stuff you do in tutorials are as well. There's nothing bad to say about her tbh.

Environmental Science 100 was a great class! The lectures were really well organized revolving around a key concept that tied to every lesson. Attendance was mandatory, Prof Holland went into detail for each slide to help the students understand the concepts better.

Tara is clearly interested in what she's talking about, and it definitely transfers over to her lectures, which are always engaging and informative, without being too content-dense. She has a very good knack for explaining difficult concepts. GEOG111 has been the highlight of my week all semester, would definitely take it again!

She is a great prof, and she wants her students to succeed. A good portion of the grade percentage is from in-class participation and tutorial work, so it helps boosts your mark if you are not great at writing exams. She is also willing to revise your midterm if it was marked unfairly. Great prof!

Tara is a good prof and uses different teaching methods to make lectures engaging. Lots of group work/class discussion. Tutorials are useful as a supplementary aid, so try to attend those too. She marks fairly based on clear learning outcomes, which makes the course accessible as an elective even for non-environment-major students.
Never thought I would consider an environmental science major but I am now. Class is engaging and interesting! Midterm exam was fair, no surprises. Tutorials help a lot with understanding concepts.

Group projects are vague at best. No real direction provided during the term-long group project, basically just grasping at straws depending on the availability of current literature of topic. Grading criteria are quite unclear and all topics graded with equal severity even if some topics are more difficult than others. Course structure needs work.
